captions.text:
Hi guys!I'm Laura Vitale and on this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen, I'm bringing you
the highly requested Orange Chicken recipe!

It has been requested here over the years
- I can't even tell you how many times, and

this is my version of an inspired - an Asian
inspired Orange Chicken that is absolutely

divine, you do not need to go to the take-out
to get orange chicken because you can make

it at home, and I can promise you, it will
be ten times better for you and it will taste
that much better!

So, let's go over the ingredients so we can
get started!

You'll need some orange zest and juice, some
chopped scallions, brown sugar, some corn

starch, soy sauce, chopped ginger and garlic,
rice wine vinegar, pinch of hot pepper flakes,

chicken stock, an egg white, some additional
corn starch, a little bit of salt, and you

will need some chicken and some vegetable
oil.

Now, the chicken I prefer to use for this
recipe is boneless skinless chicken thighs

that I have cut into bite sized pieces. Now
that's what I have in this bowl, you could

by all means, use chicken breast. I think
chicken thighs just taste much better, I've

left a little bit of fat on, but I removed
most of the fat, I just think a little bit

of fat gives you wonderful flavor, so I do
like to leave a little bit on.

You can make the same thing with chicken breast
if you prefer, try it with the chicken thighs,

because I think they just give this dish so
much flavor, I can't even tell you - and the
chicken thighs just are succulent.

So, the first thing I'm going to do is I'm
going to work on the chicken.

I'm going to season my chicken with a little
bit of salt, corn starch, I know this sounds

weird, and looks pretty strange, but trust
me when I tell you that it works. And an egg

white, what this does, is it creates like
a coating around the chicken that helps keep

the chicken - like it gets nice and crispy
and helps keep it moist - kind of like makes

the outside get crispy, but keeps all the
moisture inside. And now, I'm just taking

a fork and mixing this together until - I
want to get everything pretty combined, and

now I'm just going to set it aside and let
it sit at room temperature for about ten minutes.
That's about it!

My chicken has been sitting for about ten
minutes, and what I have here is a skillet

with high sides with a little bit of vegetable
oil getting pre-heated over about medium-high

heat, I want the oil to be nice and hot, because
when I add my chicken I want it to sizzle,
I want it to develop really good color.

So, I'm just going to test it with one piece
of chicken.
Let's see.
Yep!

That's nice and hot. I'm going to add my chicken
right into the skillet.

And now, I'm just breaking it up with my wooden
spoon, and it looks like there's a lot of

oil in there, there's only like a little less
than three tablespoons of vegetable oil, it's

just that when you put something in, it kind
of moves to the side a little bit, but anyway,

you're going to cook this for about three
to four minutes, giving it a stir every once

and a while until it's developed really nice
color.

Now, in the meantime, I'm going to take my
orange juice and zest, now I do use fresh
orange juice and zest, it makes a big difference.

I've got my chicken stock with chicken concentrate
and a little bit of water - like you guys
know I like to use.
My soy.
Then my rice vinegar.

And give this a stir with a fork along with
the brown sugar. I just like to mix those

ingredients together to get them out of the
way. And now I'm going to babysit my chicken,

I'm going to tidy up a little bit and I will
show you the next step once we are there!

My chicken has just beautiful color, I'm just
looking at this - you can just tell it's going
to be delicious.

I'm going to just add in my ginger and my
garlic now, I'm going to stir this in, I've

lowered my heat just a little bit to medium
because it was a little bit too high, and
I don't want to burn my garlic and ginger.
Ah!
The smell!

The smell of garlic and ginger sizzling - it's
amazing!

Going to let this cook for about a minute,
and then we'll add in our sauce.
Going to add in our sauce that we mixed together.

Looks like a lot, it's going to reduce quite
a bit, don't worry.

I'm going to add just a pinch of hot pepper
flakes, you can make it as hot or as mild

as you'd like, and now I'm going to just let
that sauce reduce - I've turned the heat back

up to medium-high and I'm going to let that
reduce until it's reduced by about half, it

could take up to about fifteen minutes, so
keep your eye on it and then we'll be pretty
much really close to having an awesome dinner!

That looks gorgeous! I'm going to thicken
up the sauce just a little bit, you can see

it's reduced a lot and it's only been about
ten minutes. I've got a little corn starch

here and a little bit of water, maybe a little
bit too much water. I'm going to use this
fork right here.

I'm going to add this slurry, and then all
you're going to do is you're going to let

that cook for just a couple of minutes and
then all of the sudden you have a thick and

gorgeous sauce - unbelievably good! Now what
I'm also going to do is I'm going to add some

- not all - of my scallions because I want
to serve some from the top - for the top.

Right there! Oh, just gorgeous! I'm going
to let this cook for just a minute or two

until that slurry sort of cooks out, and then
we're done! Look at that!

I mean, tell me that doesn't look ten times
better than takeout!
You know it does!
Don't lie!
Love it!
Done.

Now, I've got a beautiful plate of fluffy
rice here and I'm going to put my chicken
right in the middle - look at that!
That is just a meal fit for company!
I'm so excited to eat this!

And of course you need some fresh scallions
on top.
Mmm!
I love fresh scallions.

Okay, I'm going to go for this piece right
here simply because it looks left out, so

I'm going to make him feel a little bit better
by me eating it!

It has the most delicious, beautiful orange
flavor. Not overly sweet, it's a perfect balance

of salty and a little bit of - little bit
of tang from the rice vinegar but it is absolutely
divine.

I'm going to go back in for another piece.
LauraintheKitchen.com will have the recipe

ready for you, I hope you have enjoyed this
and I would love to hear from you how you

make your orange chicken - and what you would
like the next take-out in-home recipe to be.

I've been getting a lot of questions and requests
to do take-out recipes at home and I just
don't know what kind.

So please leave your suggestions down below,
and I will see you next time!
Bye bye!

title: Homemade Orange Chicken Recipe - Laura Vitale - Laura in the Kitchen Episode 794

orange chicken is supposed to taste like lol. Help anyone?﻿

comments.author: citem505

comments.text:
So I googled this and found that in Walmart and other stores in the US you 
can apparently buy chicken thighs already without bones and skin on? 
Revelation!
So this is why Laura always recommends these!
Because where I live you can maybe ask your butcher to do that for you, but 
it will cost you and in regular supermarkets you either get the whole 
thighs or nothing.
Which is why I never really got how she'd call these (in various recipes) a 
quick meal for weekdays - you spend quite a while deboning and skinning a 
bunch of chicken thighs until you have enough meat neatly cut up...
Ah, America - where half of the food preparation is already done for you 
when you start cooking... ^_~﻿
